intro: Hieraciodes multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered hieracium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Hieraciodes multiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
